personal.name: Reuben Stanley
personal.title: Backend Developer & AI Engineer
personal.bio: Honours Advanced Computer Science student (AI) at UWA with extensive experience building production-grade AI systems. Specialized in end-to-end AI/ML development, including data collection, model training, backend orchestration, and on-device inference. Proven track record delivering high-impact solutionsâ€”e.g., reducing semantic search latency from 180s to <7s and improving accuracy to near 100%, and launching a security-alert MVP in 4 weeks that cut false positives. Multiple-time hackathon winner and VentureUWA incubator founder focused on ML applications that drive tangible business or social impact.

projects.title: CosineOne - AI Security Alert System
projects.description: Full-stack application providing real-time, AI-powered security alerts with 4-week MVP delivery that dramatically reduced false positives for security hardware partners.
projects.long_description: Co-founded and developed a full-stack application (FastAPI backend, plain JavaScript frontend) in just 4 weeks to provide real-time, AI-powered security alerts through both a frontend overlay and Telegram bot. Engineered a sophisticated system using private, local ML models to identify and validate custom alerts (e.g., 'person in backyard'), dramatically reducing false positives for security hardware partners. The system processes video streams in real-time and applies custom ML models for intelligent alert validation.
highlights: Delivered production MVP in 4 weeks from concept to deployment
Dramatically reduced false positives using custom ML validation
Built both frontend overlay and Telegram bot interfaces
Engineered system using private, local ML models for security
Co-founded company as Lead Backend Developer

projects.title: MyBigBrain - Semantic Camera Roll Search
projects.description: Re-architected backend for semantic camera-roll search, reducing average search latency from 180s to <7s (96% decrease) and achieving near-100% retrieval accuracy.
projects.long_description: Led complete backend re-architecture for a semantic camera-roll search application, achieving a 96% reduction in average search latency from 180 seconds to under 7 seconds while improving retrieval accuracy to near-100%. Implemented sophisticated text/image embedding pipelines, face/object tagging systems, and optimized inference paths to meet production SLO requirements. Authored a reusable Python library to instantiate AI agents and integrate LLM tools for conversational photo search, enabling users to find photos through natural language queries.
highlights: Reduced search latency by 96% (from 180s to <7s)
Achieved near-100% retrieval accuracy
Implemented text/image embedding pipelines
Built face/object tagging and recognition system
Created reusable Python library for AI agent instantiation
Optimized inference paths to meet production SLO

projects.title: Eco Home Group - AI-Driven CRM & Job Optimization
projects.description: Designed AI-driven CRM that automated job booking and communications, with optimization algorithms that eliminated manual scheduling and reduced worker idle/travel time.
projects.long_description: Designed and implemented an AI-driven CRM system for a UK-based company that automated job booking and communications across multiple crews. Built a sophisticated job allocation algorithm using Google Maps API to optimize worker routing, scheduling, and travel time, significantly reducing expected idle/travel time per job and completely eliminating manual scheduling overhead. Deployed an AI phone receptionist and automated email/messaging flows for customer confirmations, creating a seamless end-to-end customer experience.
highlights: Automated entire job booking and communication workflow
Built optimization algorithm for worker routing and scheduling
Reduced idle/travel time per job through intelligent allocation
Eliminated manual scheduling completely
Deployed AI phone receptionist for customer interactions
Implemented automated email/messaging confirmation flows

projects.title: SpectraSync - Audio-Responsive LED ML Model
projects.description: Trained and deployed ML model for embedded LED hardware to generate ideal audio-responsive lightshows, successfully porting to low-power embedded systems.
projects.long_description: Trained and deployed a machine learning model to generate 'ideal' audio-responsive lightshows for embedded LED hardware. Gathered and processed a large-scale training dataset by modifying embedded C++ source code on prototype devices. Trained the model on external GPUs and successfully ported it to run efficiently on low-power embedded hardware, demonstrating expertise in both high-performance training and resource-constrained deployment.
highlights: Trained ML model for audio-responsive LED lightshows
Modified embedded C++ code to gather training data
Trained on external GPUs for optimal performance
Successfully ported model to low-power embedded hardware
Achieved real-time inference on resource-constrained devices

projects.title: Genvis Hackathon Winner - Empathetic AI Voice Agent
projects.description: 1st place winner: Led team to build privacy-first AI voice agent that auto-fills legal/medical forms from victim accounts, addressing ethical and legal constraints.
projects.long_description: Led a team to 1st place victory by building an empathetic AI voice agent that auto-fills legal and medical forms from victim accounts. Implemented privacy-first speech pipelines, intelligent form mapping, and guided UX design while carefully addressing ethical and legal constraints for sensitive data handling. The solution demonstrates technical excellence in voice AI while maintaining the highest standards for privacy and empathy in sensitive contexts.
highlights: 1st place winner at Genvis Hackathon
Led team to build empathetic AI for sensitive use cases
Implemented privacy-first speech pipelines
Built intelligent form mapping and auto-fill system
Addressed complex ethical and legal constraints
Designed guided UX for sensitive data handling

projects.title: KoalaWala - ML-Powered Speech Therapy App (1st Place)
projects.description: 1st place at Spacecubed Hackathon: Led 7-person team to prototype ML-powered speech therapy app, securing interest from therapists and seed investment offer.
projects.long_description: Led a 7-person team to 1st place at Spacecubed Student Hackathon by prototyping and pitching 'KoalaWala', an ML-powered speech therapy app, in a single weekend. Developed a full-stack application with an ML model to identify and analyze phoneme pronunciation. Secured interest from multiple speech therapists and received a post-competition offer for seed investment (which was declined to continue studies). The rapid prototype demonstrated both technical capability and market validation.
highlights: 1st place winner at Spacecubed Student Hackathon
Led 7-person team through rapid prototyping
Built ML model for phoneme pronunciation analysis
Secured interest from multiple speech therapists
Received seed investment offer post-competition
Completed full prototype in single weekend

projects.title: Battle of the Bots - Autonomous Card Game AI (3rd Place)
projects.description: 3rd place nationally: Developed autonomous agent for 'Big Two' card game using adversarial search and probabilistic evaluation, competing against 26 teams.
projects.long_description: Placed 3rd among 26 teams nationally in Battle of the Bots competition by developing an autonomous agent for the card game 'Big Two' using adversarial search and probabilistic evaluation. Built as a solo developer, the agent demonstrates sophisticated game theory implementation and efficient search algorithms to make optimal decisions under uncertainty.
highlights: 3rd place nationally (26 teams)
Solo developer achievement
Implemented adversarial search algorithms
Built probabilistic evaluation system
Applied game theory for optimal decision-making

projects.title: Brightwater Hackathon - Voice-Controlled Calling App
projects.description: Led 5-person team to build end-to-end, voice-controlled calling app for seniors using WebRTC, gaining traction with aged care companies.
projects.long_description: Led a 5-person team to build an end-to-end, voice-controlled calling app for seniors using WebRTC and Node.js. Managed the team, conducted user testing with 20+ prototypes, and gained significant traction with aged care companies. The solution addressed real accessibility challenges for elderly users through intuitive voice interfaces.
highlights: Led 5-person development team
Built complete voice-controlled calling solution
User-tested with 20+ prototypes
Gained traction with aged care companies
Implemented WebRTC for real-time communication

projects.title: Rio Tinto Hackathon - Autonomous Vehicle Path Planning
projects.description: Developed computer vision solution to read closed-source route planning system using vector math for autonomous vehicle paths, earning offer for continued development.
projects.long_description: Developed a computer vision solution to read a closed-source route planning system, using vector math to plot autonomous vehicle paths. The innovative approach to reverse-engineering and path planning earned an offer for a part-time role to develop the system further, demonstrating practical problem-solving in industrial contexts.
highlights: Developed CV solution for closed-source system reading
Implemented vector math for autonomous path planning
Received offer for part-time role continuation
Applied to real-world industrial use case

projects.title: High-Performance Convolution Library
projects.description: Created highly optimized C library for performing convolutions on images across multiple nodes in high-performance computing clusters.
projects.long_description: Developed a highly optimized C library for performing image convolutions across multiple nodes in high-performance computing clusters using OpenMP and MPI. The implementation demonstrates deep understanding of parallel computing, memory optimization, and distributed systems. Achieved significant performance gains through careful optimization of memory access patterns and inter-node communication.
highlights: Built highly optimized convolution library in C
Implemented multi-node parallel processing
Used OpenMP and MPI for distributed computing
Optimized for HPC cluster performance
Deployed on Setonix Supercomputer

projects.title: Quantitative Trading Systems
projects.description: Developed and backtested quantitative trading strategies, achieving 2nd place in QFin x Etoro Trading Competition using algorithmic approaches.
projects.long_description: Developed and backtested quantitative trading strategies for algorithmic trading. Utilized sophisticated algorithmic approaches to trade commodities in the QFin x Etoro Trading Competition, achieving a close 2nd place finish. The work demonstrates strong understanding of financial markets, statistical analysis, and algorithmic decision-making under uncertainty.
highlights: 2nd place in QFin x Etoro Trading Competition
Developed algorithmic trading strategies
Implemented backtesting frameworks
Applied statistical modeling to financial markets

blog_posts.title: Optimizing Semantic Search: From 180s to <7s
blog_posts.excerpt: A deep dive into re-architecting a semantic search system, covering embedding pipelines, inference optimization, and achieving 96% latency reduction while maintaining near-perfect accuracy.

blog_posts.title: Building Privacy-First AI Systems with Local ML Models
blog_posts.excerpt: How we built a real-time security alert system using private, local ML models to dramatically reduce false positives while maintaining user privacy and data security.

blog_posts.title: Deploying ML Models on Embedded Hardware
